isis.stitle: Recall 96509 - Accelerator Pedal to Floor Interference 3800 Bus with I6 Electronic Engine

recall.subject: Accelerator Pedal to Floor Interference 3800 Bus with I6 Electronic Engine

defect.para: This Recall applies to 3800 bus built 05/01/1996 through 11/07/1996 with the I6 electronic engine and the extra thick bus body floor.

The accelerator pedal to floor clearance on bus chassis built by Navistar is approximately 1.2 inches with a standard bus body floor. However, some customers order buses with an additional 3/4 inch plywood floor and extra thick floor mat which serves as insulation in cold weather areas or as a sound deadener. When the extra thick flooring is used, there is the possibility the bottom edge of the accelerator pedal, when depressed, could come in contact with the floor.

para.emph: Should the accelerator pedal, while being depressed, come in contact with the floor, there is the possibility the engine throttle may not return to the idle position. Should this happen with the vehicle in motion, it could cause the operator to lose control of the bus and result in a crash, causing personal injury, property damage or both.

defect.para: Owners will be notified of this campaign on their vehicles by Navistar. A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

step1.para: With accelerator pedal fully depressed, inspect for 1/4 inch minimum clearance between the bottom of the accelerator pedal and the floor. If there is less than 1/4 inch clearance, the accelerator pedal must be reworked. During this procedure, the accelerator pedal should be rotated through its full travel to assure that the 1/4 inch clearance is present when the accelerator pedal is closest to the floor.
If rework is necessary, remove the accelerator pedal/rod assembly by removing 2 screws attaching the pedal rod to electronic control unit.
Cut 1/2 inch from the bottom (non-tapered edge) of the pedal and grind the cut edge to remove sharp burrs.
Re-install pedal/rod assembly to electronic control unit.
Depress accelerator pedal fully and check for a minimum of 1/4 inch clearance to the floor.

partsinfo.para: None required to perform this inspection and repair.

entry.para: Inspect accelerator pedal to floor clearance
Inspect accelerator pedal to floor clearance; Rework accelerator pedal

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward. The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair the vehicle as soon as possible.
